<h1 class="firstHeading mw-first-heading" id="firstHeading"><span class="mw-page-title-main">Beijing</span></h1>
<div class="vector-body" id="bodyContent">
<div class="noprint" id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
<div id="contentSub"></div>
<div id="contentSub2"></div>
<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>

<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#searchInput">Jump to search</a>
<div class="mw-body-content mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Capital city of China</div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1033289096">.mw-parser-output .hatnote{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output div.hatnote{padding-left:1.6em;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .hatnote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .hatnote+link+.hatnote{margin-top:-0.5em}</style><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">For other uses, see <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/Beijing_(disambiguation)" title="Beijing (disambiguation)">Beijing (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">"Peking" redirects here; for other uses, see <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/Peking_(disambiguation)" title="Peking (disambiguation)">Peking (disambiguation)</a>. "Beijinger" redirects here; for the magazine, see <a href="/wiki/The_Beijinger" title="The Beijinger">The Beijinger</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">

title="Cantonese">Yue: Cantonese</a></th></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row" style="font-weight:normal;"><a href="/wiki/Yale_romanization_of_Cantonese" title="Yale romanization of Cantonese">Yale Romanization</a></th><td class="infobox-data"><span title="Yue Chinese-language romanization"><span lang="yue-Latn" style="font-style: normal">Bākgìng <i>or</i> Bākgīng</span></span></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row" style="font-weight:normal;"><a href="/wiki/Jyutping" title="Jyutping">Jyutping</a></th><td class="infobox-data"><span title="Yue Chinese-language romanization"><span lang="yue-Latn" style="font-style: normal">Bak1ging1</span></span></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row" style="font-weight:normal;"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Cantonese" title="Help:IPA/Cantonese">IPA</a></th><td class="infobox-data"><span title="Yue Chinese-language romanization"><span lang="yue-Latn" style="font-style: normal"><span class="IPA" lang="yue-Latn-fonipa" style="white-space:nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Cantonese" title="Help:IPA/Cantonese">[pɐ́k̚.kêŋ]</a></span> <i>or</i> <span class="IPA" lang="yue-Latn-fonipa" style="white-space:nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Cantonese" title="Help:IPA/Cantonese">[pɐ́k̚.kéŋ]</a></span></span></span></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-header" colspan="2" style="background-color: #dcffc9;"><a href="/wiki/Southern_Min" title="Southern Min">Southern Min</a></th></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row" style="font-weight:normal;"><a href="/wiki/Hokkien" title="Hokkien">Hokkien</a> <a href="/wiki/Pe%CC%8Dh-%C5%8De-j%C4%AB" title="Pe̍h-ōe-jī">POJ</a></th><td class="infobox-data"><span title="Min Nan Chinese-language romanization"><span lang="nan-Latn" style="font-style: normal">Pak-kiaⁿ</span></span></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row" style="font-weight:normal;"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Taiwanese_Romanization_System" title="Taiwanese Romanization System">Tâi-lô</a></th><td class="infobox-data"><span title="Min Nan Chinese-language romanization"><span lang="nan-Latn" style="font-style: normal">Pak-kiann</span></span></td></tr><tr><th class="infobox-header" colspan="2" style="background-color: #dcffc9;"><a href="/wiki/Eastern_Min" title="Eastern Min">Eastern Min</a></th></tr><tr><th class="infobox-label" scope="row" style="font-weight:normal;"><a href="/wiki/Fuzhou_dialect" title="Fuzhou dialect">Fuzhou</a> <a href="/wiki/Foochow_Romanized" title="Foochow Romanized">BUC</a></th><td class="infobox-data"><span title="Min Dong Chinese-language romanization"><span lang="cdo-Latn" style="font-style: normal">Báe̤k-gĭng</span></span></td></tr></tbody></table></td><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1066479718" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></tr><tr style="display:none"><td colspan="2">
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Beijing</b> (<span class="rt-commentedText nowrap"><span class="IPA nopopups noexcerpt" lang="en-fonipa"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/English" title="Help:IPA/English">/<span style="border-bottom:1px dotted"><span title="'b' in 'buy'">b</span><span title="/eɪ/: 'a' in 'face'">eɪ</span><span title="/ˈ/: primary stress follows">ˈ</span><span title="/dʒ/: 'j' in 'jam'">dʒ</span><span title="/ɪ/: 'i' in 'kit'">ɪ</span><span title="/ŋ/: 'ng' in 'sing'">ŋ</span></span>/</a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Help:Pronunciation_respelling_key" title="Help:Pronunciation respelling key"><i title="English pronunciation respelling">bay-<span style="font-size:90%">JING</span></i></a>;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10"><a href="#cite_note-10">[9]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-longman_11-0"><a href="#cite_note-longman-11">[10]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Chinese_language" title="Chinese language">Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh">北京</span>; <a href="/wiki/Pinyin" title="Pinyin">pinyin</a>: <i><span lang="zh-Latn-pinyin">Běijīng</span></i>; <span style="font-size:85%;">Mandarin pronunciation:</span> <span class="IPA" lang="cmn-Latn-fonipa" style="white-space:nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Mandarin" title="Help:IPA/Mandarin">[pèɪ.tɕíŋ]</a></span> <span class="nowrap" style="font-size:85%">(<span class="unicode haudio"><span class="fn"><span style="white-space:nowrap;margin-right:.25em;"><a href="/wiki/File:Beijing_pronunciation.ogg" title="About this sound"><img alt="" data-file-height="20" data-file-width="20" decoding="async" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/17px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/22px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 2x" width="11"/></a></span><a class="internal" href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c8/Beijing_pronunciation.ogg" title="Beijing pronunciation.ogg">listen</a></span></span>)</span>), <a href="/wiki/Chinese_postal_romanization" title="Chinese postal romanization">alternatively romanized</a> as <b>Peking</b><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12"><a href="#cite_note-12">[11]</a></sup> (<span class="rt-commentedText nowrap"><span class="IPA nopopups noexcerpt" lang="en-fonipa"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/English" title="Help:IPA/English">/<span style="border-bottom:1px dotted"><span title="'p' in 'pie'">p</span><span title="/iː/: 'ee' in 'fleece'">iː</span><span title="/ˈ/: primary stress follows">ˈ</span><span title="'k' in 'kind'">k</span><span title="/ɪ/: 'i' in 'kit'">ɪ</span><span title="/ŋ/: 'ng' in 'sing'">ŋ</span></span>/</a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Help:Pronunciation_respelling_key" title="Help:Pronunciation respelling key"><i title="English pronunciation respelling">pee-<span style="font-size:90%">KING</span></i></a>),<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13"><a href="#cite_note-13">[12]</a></sup> is the <a href="/wiki/Capital_city" title="Capital city">capital</a> of the <a href="/wiki/China" title="China">People's Republic of China</a>. It is the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Politics_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China" title="Politics of the People's Republic of China">political</a> center, <a href="/wiki/Chinese_culture" title="Chinese culture">cultural</a> center, international communication center and scientific and technological innovation center of the country.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14"><a href="#cite_note-14">[13]</a></sup> Beijing is the world's <a href="/wiki/List_of_national_capitals_by_population" title="List of national capitals by population">most populous national capital city</a>, with over 21 million residents within an <a href="/wiki/City_proper" title="City proper">administrative area</a> of 16,410.5 km<sup>2</sup> (6336 sq. mi.).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-bulletin2018_15-0"><a href="#cite_note-bulletin2018-15">[14]</a></sup> Nevertheless, its built-up area, the third largest in China after <a href="/wiki/Guangzhou" title="Guangzhou">Guangzhou</a> and <a href="/wiki/Shanghai" title="Shanghai">Shanghai</a>, is slightly bigger, including three districts in <a href="/wiki/Hebei" title="Hebei">Hebei</a> (<a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sanhe_City" title="Sanhe City">Sanhe</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dachang_County" title="Dachang County">Dachang Hui</a> and <a href="/wiki/Zhuozhou" title="Zhuozhou">Zhuozhou</a>) being conurbated but with <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Miyun" title="Miyun">Miyun</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pinggu" title="Pinggu">Pinggu</a> Districts in Beijing not agglomerated yet.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-16"><a href="#cite_note-16">[15]</a></sup> It is located in <a href="/wiki/North_China" title="North China">Northern China</a>, and is governed as a <a href="/wiki/Direct-administered_municipalities_of_China" title="Direct-administered municipalities of China">municipality</a> under the direct administration of the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Government_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China" title="Government of the People's Republic of China">State Council</a> with <a href="/wiki/List_of_administrative_divisions_of_Beijing" title="List of administrative divisions of Beijing">16 urban, suburban, and rural districts</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-figures_17-0"><a href="#cite_note-figures-17">[16]</a></sup> Beijing is mostly surrounded by Hebei Province with the exception of neighboring <a href="/wiki/Tianjin" title="Tianjin">Tianjin</a> to the southeast; together, the three divisions form the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Jingjinji" title="Jingjinji">Jingjinji</a> <a href="/wiki/Megalopolises_in_China" title="Megalopolises in China">megalopolis</a> and the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/National_capital_region" title="National capital region">national capital region</a> of China.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-basic_18-0"><a href="#cite_note-basic-18">[17]</a></sup>
</p><p>Beijing is a <a href="/wiki/Global_city" title="Global city">global city</a> and one of the world's leading centres for <a href="#Culture">culture</a>, <a href="#International_relations">diplomacy</a>, <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_Beijing" title="Politics of Beijing">politics</a>, <a href="/wiki/Global_Financial_Centres_Index" title="Global Financial Centres Index">finance</a>, <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Beijing" title="Economy of Beijing">business and economics</a>, <a href="#Education_and_research">education</a>, <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_by_scientific_output" title="List of cities by scientific output">research</a>, <a href="/wiki/Beijing_dialect" title="Beijing dialect">language</a>, <a href="#Places_of_interest">tourism</a>, <a href="#Media">media</a>, <a href="#Sports">sport</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Science_and_technology_in_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China" title="Science and technology in the People's Republic of China">science and technology</a> and <a href="/wiki/Transport_in_China" title="Transport in China">transportation</a>. As a <a href="/wiki/Megacity" title="Megacity">megacity</a>, Beijing is the second largest Chinese city by <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China_by_urban_population" title="List of cities in the People's Republic of China by urban population">urban population</a> after Shanghai.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-columbia_encyclopaedia_19-0"><a href="#cite_note-columbia_encyclopaedia-19">[18]</a></sup> It is home to the headquarters of most of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_the_largest_companies_of_China" title="List of the largest companies of China">China's largest state-owned companies</a> and houses the largest number of <a href="/wiki/Fortune_Global_500" title="Fortune Global 500">Fortune Global 500</a> companies in the world, as well as the world's four biggest <a href="/wiki/List_of_largest_banks" title="List of largest banks">financial institutions</a> by total assets.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-20"><a href="#cite_note-20">[19]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Beijing_International_21-0"><a href="#cite_note-Beijing_International-21">[20]</a></sup> It is also a <a href="/wiki/Transport_in_Beijing" title="Transport in Beijing">major hub</a> for the <a href="/wiki/China_National_Highways_of_Beijing" title="China National Highways of Beijing">national highway</a>, <a href="/wiki/Expressways_of_Beijing" title="Expressways of Beijing">expressway</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Rail_transport_in_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China#Current_network" title="Rail transport in the People's Republic of China">railway</a>, and <a href="/wiki/High-speed_rail_in_China" title="High-speed rail in China">high-speed rail</a> networks. The <a href="/wiki/Beijing_Capital_International_Airport" title="Beijing Capital International Airport">Beijing Capital International Airport</a> has been the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/World%27s_busiest_airports_by_passenger_traffic" title="World's busiest airports by passenger traffic">second busiest in the world by passenger traffic</a> (<a href="/wiki/List_of_the_busiest_airports_in_Asia" title="List of the busiest airports in Asia">Asia's busiest</a>) since 2010,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ACI_aero_22-0"><a href="#cite_note-ACI_aero-22">[21]</a></sup> and, as of 2016<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Beijing&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, the city's <a href="/wiki/Beijing_Subway" title="Beijing Subway">subway network</a> is the <a href="/wiki/List_of_metro_systems" title="List of metro systems">busiest</a> and <a href="/wiki/List_of_metro_systems" title="List of metro systems">longest in the world</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Beijing_Daxing_International_Airport" title="Beijing Daxing International Airport">Beijing Daxing International Airport</a>, a second international airport in Beijing, is the largest single-structure <a href="/wiki/Airport_terminal" title="Airport terminal">airport terminal</a> in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-23"><a href="#cite_note-23">[22]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-24"><a href="#cite_note-24">[23]</a></sup>
</p><p>Combining both modern and traditional style <a href="#Architecture">architectures</a>, Beijing is <a href="/wiki/List_of_oldest_continuously_inhabited_cities" title="List of oldest continuously inhabited cities">one of the oldest cities in the world</a>, with a rich <a href="/wiki/History_of_Beijing" title="History of Beijing">history</a> dating back over three millennia. As the last of the <a href="/wiki/Historical_capitals_of_China" title="Historical capitals of China">Four Great Ancient Capitals of China</a>, Beijing has been the political center of the country for most of the past eight centuries,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-25"><a href="#cite_note-25">[24]</a></sup> and was the <a href="/wiki/List_of_largest_cities_throughout_history" title="List of largest cities throughout history">largest city in the world by population</a> for much of the <a href="/wiki/2nd_millennium" title="2nd millennium">second millennium CE</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Top_Ten_Cities_By_Population_Throughout_History_26-0"><a href="#cite_note-Top_Ten_Cities_By_Population_Throughout_History-26">[25]</a></sup> With mountains surrounding the inland city on three sides, in addition to the <a href="/wiki/Beijing_city_fortifications" title="Beijing city fortifications">old inner and outer city walls</a>, Beijing was strategically poised and developed to be the residence of the <a href="/wiki/Emperor_of_China" title="Emperor of China">emperor</a> and thus was the perfect location for the imperial capital. The city is renowned for its opulent palaces, temples, parks, gardens, tombs, <a href="/wiki/Beijing_city_fortifications" title="Beijing city fortifications">walls and gates</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-world_book_27-0"><a href="#cite_note-world_book-27">[26]</a></sup> Beijing is one of the most important tourist destinations of the world. In 2018, Beijing was the second highest earning tourist city in the world after Shanghai.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:12_28-0"><a href="#cite_note-:12-28">[27]</a></sup> Beijing is home to many national <a href="/wiki/List_of_museums_in_China#Beijing" title="List of museums in China">monuments and museums</a> and has <a href="/wiki/List_of_World_Heritage_Sites_in_China" title="List of World Heritage Sites in China">seven</a> <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> <a href="/wiki/World_Heritage_Site" title="World Heritage Site">World Heritage Sites</a>—the <a href="/wiki/Forbidden_City" title="Forbidden City">Forbidden City</a>, <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Heaven" title="Temple of Heaven">Temple of Heaven</a>, <a href="/wiki/Summer_Palace" title="Summer Palace">Summer Palace</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ming_Tombs" title="Ming Tombs">Ming Tombs</a>, <a href="/wiki/Zhoukoudian" title="Zhoukoudian">Zhoukoudian</a>, and parts of the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Great_Wall" title="Great Wall">Great Wall</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Grand_Canal_(China)" title="Grand Canal (China)">Grand Canal</a>—all of which are popular tourist locations.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-29"><a href="#cite_note-29">[28]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Siheyuan" title="Siheyuan">Siheyuans</a>, the city's traditional housing style, and <a href="/wiki/Hutong" title="Hutong">hutongs</a>, the narrow alleys between siheyuans, are major tourist attractions and are common in urban Beijing.
</p><p>Many of <a href="/wiki/List_of_universities_and_colleges_in_Beijing" title="List of universities and colleges in Beijing">Beijing's public universities</a> consistently rank among the best in the <a href="/wiki/Asia-Pacific" title="Asia-Pacific">Asia-Pacific</a> and the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:4_30-0"><a href="#cite_note-:4-30">[29]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:5_31-0"><a href="#cite_note-:5-31">[30]</a></sup> Beijing is home to the two best <a href="/wiki/C9_League" title="C9 League">C9 League</a> <a href="/wiki/University" title="University">universities</a> (<a href="/wiki/Tsinghua_University" title="Tsinghua University">Tsinghua</a> and <a href="/wiki/Peking_University" title="Peking University">Peking</a>) in the Asia-Pacific and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Emerging_countries" title="Emerging countries">emerging countries</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:6_32-0"><a href="#cite_note-:6-32">[31]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:8_33-0"><a href="#cite_note-:8-33">[32]</a></sup> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Beijing_CBD" title="Beijing CBD">Beijing CBD</a> is a center for <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Beijing" title="Economy of Beijing">Beijing's economic expansion</a>, with the ongoing or recently completed construction of <a href="/wiki/List_of_tallest_buildings_in_Beijing" title="List of tallest buildings in Beijing">multiple skyscrapers</a>. Beijing's <a href="/wiki/Zhongguancun" title="Zhongguancun">Zhongguancun</a> area is a world leading center of scientific and technological innovation as well as entrepreneurship. Beijing has been ranked the city with the largest scientific research output by the <a href="/wiki/Nature_Index" title="Nature Index">Nature Index</a> since 2016.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:10_34-0"><a href="#cite_note-:10-34">[33]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:9_35-0"><a href="#cite_note-:9-35">[34]</a></sup> The city has hosted numerous international and national sporting events, the most notable being the <a href="/wiki/2008_Summer_Olympics" title="2008 Summer Olympics">2008 Summer Olympics</a> and <a href="/wiki/2008_Summer_Paralympics" title="2008 Summer Paralympics">2008 Summer Paralympics</a> Games. In 2022, Beijing became the first city ever to host both the <a href="/wiki/2008_Summer_Olympics" title="2008 Summer Olympics">Summer</a> and <a href="/wiki/2022_Winter_Olympics" title="2022 Winter Olympics">Winter Olympics</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:2_36-0"><a href="#cite_note-:2-36">[35]</a></sup> and also the <a href="/wiki/2008_Summer_Paralympics" title="2008 Summer Paralympics">Summer</a> and <a href="/wiki/2022_Winter_Paralympics" title="2022 Winter Paralympics">Winter Paralympics</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:3_37-0"><a href="#cite_note-:3-37">[36]</a></sup> Beijing hosts <a href="/wiki/List_of_diplomatic_missions_in_China" title="List of diplomatic missions in China">175 foreign embassies</a> as well as the headquarters of many organizations, including the <a href="/wiki/Asian_Infrastructure_Investment_Bank" title="Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank">Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB)</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_Cooperation_Organisation" title="Shanghai Cooperation Organisation">Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO)</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Silk_Road_Fund" title="Silk Road Fund">Silk Road Fund</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Chinese_Academy_of_Sciences" title="Chinese Academy of Sciences">Chinese Academy of Sciences</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Chinese_Academy_of_Engineering" title="Chinese Academy of Engineering">Chinese Academy of Engineering</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Chinese_Academy_of_Social_Sciences" title="Chinese Academy of Social Sciences">Chinese Academy of Social Sciences</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Central_Academy_of_Fine_Arts" title="Central Academy of Fine Arts">Central Academy of Fine Arts</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Central_Academy_of_Drama" title="Central Academy of Drama">Central Academy of Drama</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Central_Conservatory_of_Music" title="Central Conservatory of Music">Central Conservatory of Music</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Red_Cross_Society_of_China" title="Red Cross Society of China">Red Cross Society of China</a>.
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886046785">.mw-parser-output .toclimit-2 .toclevel-1 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-3 .toclevel-2 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-4 .toclevel-3 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-5 .toclevel-4 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-6 .toclevel-5 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-7 .toclevel-6 ul{display:none}</style><div class="toclimit-3"><div aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading" class="toc" id="toc" role="navigation"><input class="toctogglecheckbox" id="toctogglecheckbox" role="button" style="display:none" type="checkbox"/><div class="toctitle" dir="ltr" lang="en"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

<ul>

<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-15"><a href="#Readings"><span class="tocnumber">3.5</span> <span class="toctext">Readings</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-16"><a href="#Dust_storms"><span class="tocnumber">3.5.1</span> <span class="toctext">Dust storms</span></a></li>
</ul>

</ul>
</li>
